intro: Hieracium saezii, commonly known as the Sáez's hawkweed, is a perennial flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of Central Europe. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in alpine and subalpine environments, thriving in well-drained, rocky soils. Its leaves are usually lance-shaped and covered in fine hairs, while its flowers are yellow with a central disc. Hieracium saezii is often found in meadows and grasslands at high altitudes, where it plays a role in stabilizing soil and supporting local biodiversity.
